summary: The Major Richard Star Act amends Title 10 of the United States Code to allow veterans with combat-related disabilities to concurrently receive both veterans' disability compensation and retired pay, without reduction. The bill eliminates previous restrictions regarding the offset of pay and ensures that eligible retirees are paid both benefits. It includes technical and conforming amendments to update the relevant sections of the code and specifies that the changes take effect on the first day of the month following enactment.
